intro: Wurmbea ciliata, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It blooms during the summer months, producing clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Wurmbea ciliata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
